Create a digital notebook on your phone or tablet using note-taking apps like Evernote or OneNote. This way, you can easily access your notes from anywhere and add new ones as needed.
Use a whiteboard to write down important information. You can take pictures of it later and use them for reference.
Write everything by hand in a large spiral-bound notebook. It may be time-consuming, but it will force you to slow down and think about what you're writing.
Create a physical database using index cards or post-it notes. You can organize them into categories and easily find what you need.
Use a voice recorder to record important conversations or lectures. You can then transcribe them later if needed.
